channel.title: Hawk tool issues
channel.description:
Well up until now hawkeye worked fine for me but after a while when i type the command i would get knocked off and the message would say "Internal Server Error"
When i logged back in it happened again and after that it would say enabled but i would get no message sent to me when i would hit a block but when i placed the dirt it would disappear instantly like it normally does.
AgentMoose and Deathwilldie have this same issue

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @acet1997 acet1997
item.description:
@acet1997 wrote:

it doesnt work for me the dirt block does nothing it just dissapears again after wards

Read full topic

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Hawkeye seems to be the only choice right now for this type of thing, if one of you wants to fix and start maintaining big brother, then we can probably switch to that.

Or if you can find another alternative.

Read full topic

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:11, topic:411661”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=512915.msg3724526#msg3724526 date=1314161955]
Try it again after the server restarts. Tell me if you get any errors at all.
[/quote]

It hasnt worked for him since you added the plugin in the first place[/quote]

it worked when it was first added but now it doesnt bb was alot more reliable just remove cmd logging

Read full topic

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @Spankr_Poodle Spankr Poodle
item.description:
@Spankr_Poodle wrote:

HawkEye has yet to work for me.

I don’t get any error. When I left click something, it doesn’t say anything. Right clicking drops the dirt as if I am checking who edited the block, but it still says nothing. Doesn’t even say “No edits”.

Read full topic

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Yes zuppers, I or you could have done that, but as to updating it when the next version of craftbukkit and/or minecraft comes out, I don’t want any part of it. So I’d rather change to something that is maintained.

Read full topic

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:411661”]I could turn it off, but then how would you post proof? At least with this hawkeye tool it is aware of potentially sensitive commands and lets me specify which ones NOT to log.

If you meant is there a way to keep big brother and stop it from logging commands, the answer is no, also it’s buggy and no one is developing it anymore.[/quote]I’m sure you could of easily modified BB to not log certain commands. Because I know I could at least do that much. As for it being buggy I haven’t read the recent bug reports for it. From my point of view BB would be better if me or you fixed the command logging issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

I see, well hopefully the kinks can be worked out of hawkeye

Read full topic

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I could turn it off, but then how would you post proof? At least with this hawkeye tool it is aware of potentially sensitive commands and lets me specify which ones NOT to log.

If you meant is there a way to keep big brother and stop it from logging commands, the answer is no, also it’s buggy and no one is developing it anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Hawk tool issues
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Yes it works now, but that doesnt take away from the issue that it breaks sometimes.

Is there no way to turn off the command logging for bb log, that is how people were seeing passwords right?

Read full topic
